poem:
"Morning Musings Over Davos Headlines"

Talks of climate and chaos over breakfast eggs,
In a shroud of morning silence heavy as champagne.
Limos lined up like polished silverware,
While up above, Alpine snow whispers of war.
The shops turned temporary tech titans' lairs,
In the ghostly shadow of Mann's Magic Mountain.
Each Davos dawn laced with global gloom,
And yet, the world keeps spinning, room to room.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Climate, chaos and war fill a doomy agenda at Davos The limos have been booked. Hotels have loaded up with champagne. Shops have been converted into pop-up offices for the tech giants. The annual Davos talkfest is about to begin. The collective mood of the 2,800 participants is anything but cheery as they make their way to the small Alpine town immortalised by Thomas Mann in his novel The Magic Mountain for the annual meeting". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
